result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mirlinda Rahmani

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Mirlinda Rahmani
Current: 1730 49th St SW Apt 103, Fargo, ND 51803   (Effective: 08-10-2022)
Prior: 2230 West College Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53221

Defendant Mirlinda Rahmani in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement hearing. 

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

As to Counts 1, 2, and 3: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 29.  Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, filed.
records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.

Defendant Mirlinda Rahmani in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests a DPA hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Mirlinda Rahmani in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Jessica Ann Behling for Mallory Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Jorge Gutierrez - Cudahy Police Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mirlinda Rahmani in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Kerri Cleghorn to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EL UNLESS congruent with any orders from DMCPS or CCC. If no orders from these
sources exist, this no contact order will become a NO VIOLENT CONTACT ORDER.

Defendant Mirlinda Rahmani in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for an indigency hearing in Branch 29.  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/27/2022@02:00pm
